newsitem.title: JAPAN: N.Korea says military joins work to boost harvest.
newsitem.headline: N.Korea says military joins work to boost harvest.

text.p: North Korea announced on Sunday that its armed forces were joining an all-out battle against food shortages in the communist nation.
An official Korean Radio report, monitored in Tokyo, said the armed forces would take on any agricultural task to ensure a "bumper harvest" this year.

The radio said meetings of commanding officers and soldiers from the army, navy, and airforce, communist party officials and people from all walks of life had decided on a war on food shortages caused by two years of record floods.

The meetings agreed that soldiers "must further solidify the unity of the army and people and achieve a bumper harvest this year without fail by launching into the struggle to assist rural areas and actively contribute to agricultural production."
Soldiers would take "a plunge into water or fire for any task to increase grain output for the people," the radio said.
